result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian F Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Polk County Case Number 14CF62

miscConds.notes: $1000.00 cash bond applied and remainder returned to whomever posted it. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 2 days credit if revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian F Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian F Jones in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Brian F Jones in custody.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:17 Case called - Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 are Dismissed and Read In.  PSI previously prepared in 2014.  Attorney Raymond makes corrections to PSI.  State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 3 years Probation - Concurrent to Polk County Case No. 14CF62
2 days jail credit if revoked
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must maintain absolute sobriety
Court costs including DNA surcharge - Bond money to be applied

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Sample to be taken before his release from the Barron County Jail.  Voting rights and firearm warning given.

Jail Faxed

Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense relates that Defendant is in the Polk County jail. Case reset as State will need to issue a writ for Defendant. Judicial Assistant to provide Court with copy of the Polk County PSI.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brian F Jones in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Brian F Jones in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant currently serving time in Polk County. 

Jail - faxed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brian F Jones in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset  Plea hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brian F Jones in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reading of Information waived.  Defendant stands mute and Court enters not guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brian F Jones in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:04 Deputy James Pressley called, sworn and direct by State.
State requests Court to take judicial notice of Polk County bail bond.  Court takes judicial notice of bond.
8:10 Cross by Attorney Hinde.
8:15 State rests.
8:16 Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over.

  Arraignment scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must have no contact with the St. Croix Casino.

Defendant Brian F Jones in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Brian F Jones in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for PD.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:00 am.
